entry.title: New Story: Balikbayan
entry.content:
I have my first publication out in Solarpunk Magazine!

It was written for their May 2022 Microfiction Contest, which was themed “Solarpunk in Asia and the Pacific Islands.” I wrote it fresh off finishing Alex G. Pacman’s Filipino Ghost Stories, and wanted to mix ghost stories with the solarpunk aesthetic and a healthy dose of diaspora mango angst.

Recently I’ve been really interested in solarpunk and utopian stories; given The Times they’re especially soothing.

Read it here!
entry.summary: I have my first publication out in Solarpunk Magazine!

entry.title: Test2
entry.content:
An apple is a sweet, edible fruit produced by an apple tree.

Apple trees are cultivated worldwide, and are the most widely grown species in the genus Malus. The tree originated in Central Asia, where its wild ancestor, Malus sievers still found today. Apples have been grown for thousands of years in Asia and Europe, and were brought to North America by European colonists.s
entry.summary: An apple is a sweet, edible fruit produced by an apple tree.

entry.title: Test3
entry.content:
Kiwifruit (often abbreviated as kiwi), or Chinese gooseberry is the edible berry of several species of woody vines in the genus Actinidia.

The most common cultivar group of kiwifruit is oval, about the size of a large hen’s egg (5–8 cm (2.0–3.1 in) in length and 4.5–5.5 cm (1.8–2.2 in) in diameter). It has a fibrous, dull greenish-brown skin and bright green or golden flesh with rows of tiny, black, edible seeds. The fruit has a soft texture, with a sweet and unique flavor.
entry.summary: Kiwifruit (often abbreviated as kiwi), or Chinese gooseberry is the edible berry of several species of woody vines in the genus Actinidia.
